availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Frankfort, Kentucky, physician. Served in the Green River Battalion (U.S.A.) as assistant physician from April 6, 1865 to August 23, 1865.

ab.bibl:
Report of the Adjutant General of the State of Kentucky, vol. 2, 1861-1866 (Frankfort: Kentucky Yeoman Office, 1866), 799.
“Obituaries: C.F. Ulrich,” American Medicine: A Weekly Journal Founded, Owned, and Controlled by the Medical Profession of American Vol. 5 (Philadelphia, PA: American-Medicine Publishing Company, January-June, 1903): 365.
Special Schedules of the Eleventh Census (1890), Enumerating Union Veterans and Widows of Union Veterans of the Civil War, Records of the Department of Veterans Affairs, M123, RG 15.
